item.title: Uncovered food waste litter attracting flies, 14th June
item.description:
Uncovered white litter bin attracting flies as well as abandoned cardboard bedding from a rough sleeper behind Coco Di Mamma on Howick Place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 139, Victoria Street, Victoria, London

item.title: Large quantity of litter, no street cleaner down SGE in 2 weeks plus, 14th June
item.description:
There's litter in the street that has been here for weeks. The street has used nappies strewn around it because of the bags overflowing from the dumpster for the flats above Indig's. There's an abandoned bag on the other side of road too. Thank you!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Grove West, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree down on pathway, obstruction, 14th June
item.description:
A tree has fallen overnight blocking the pathway, this path is used by people going from High Grove Road and neighbouring streets to Plum Road and vice versa, especially school children during the week. We managed to create an opening by removing some of the small branches but not sure how safe the area is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dot Hill, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass needs cutting-i almost broke my leg as the area is nit maintained, 14th June
item.description:
This grass is not cut properly- this is a health&safety issue as the area is not levelled as due to high grass you canâ€™t see what is underneath. The dog waste container is not accessible, you cannot walk safely on the slopes. There is many dogs poos that are not cleaned due to tall grass and also people keep throwing rubbish there. We pay over 2k council tax for the area to be maintained and accessible for everyone. Please resolve ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major Rubbish Issue, 14th June
item.description:
Hello, I am a resident living in Anthony Court, the adjacent building to this bin and I am severely concerned with the level of accumulating waste that is being dumped and has not been collected in over 2 weeks. This has been an ongoing issue for 10 years and as residents we are all at our wits end. This bin area was made for us in the block only however due to being poorly constructed, unlovable and accessible to all it has become the local dumping ground. Filled with all sorts of rubbish it is a breeding ground for pests and we have a major issue with rats, mice, and foxes infesting our building. Being oknthr ground floor level and with it being summer time, windows can not be opened due to the major fly issue that stems from this bin in addition to the horrendous smells radiating from the rubbish. We simply can not live this way, not only is this a major environmental health issue, it is negligence from Southwark and the housing association to have allowed this was to go on for so many years without a proper review and resolution. My late mother was fighting about the serious issues of this bin as mentioned above for over 10 years and enough is now enough. This needs to be fixed urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
